author: Ashleigh Fields
description: A third suspect accused of killing Eric Tarpinian-Jachym was arrested on Wednesday in Washington, D.C. Naqwan Antonio Lucas was apprehended by Metropolitan Police, who believe he was involved in Tarpinian-Jachym’s death and the fatal shooting of 17-year-old Zoey Kelley.  Tarpinian-Jachym was 21 years old when he died in July. He was a student at the…
title: Third suspect arrested in deadly shooting of congressional intern

author: The Hill Staff
description: President Trump, fresh from his trip to Asia, will host a Halloween celebration Thursday evening at the White House. Trump and first lady Melania Trump are expected to hand out commemorative candies. The U.S. Air Force Strolling Strings band is also scheduled to play Halloween music mixed with modern tunes, according to the White House.…
title: Watch live: Trump, first lady host Halloween event at White House

author: Nathaniel Weixel
description: Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. said there is not “sufficient” evidence that Tylenol causes autism, softening warnings he and President Trump have repeatedly made to discourage the medicine’s use by pregnant women and young children.   During a press conference Wednesday, Kennedy reiterated that pregnant women should use Tylenol only when “absolutely necessary.”  “We’ve all said from the beginning…
title: RFK Jr. says no ‘sufficient’ evidence Tylenol definitively causes autism

author: Max Rego
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth has extended the deployment of National Guard troops in Washington, D.C., through February, a Defense Department official confirmed to The Hill. The deployment of more than 2,000 service members was set to expire at the end of November, the official added. An Army official also told The Hill the troops are…
title: Hegseth extends National Guard in DC through February

author: Ryan Mancini
description: With ObamaCare insurance options opening up for enrollment Saturday, one group of Americans could see their monthly premiums increase should tax credits expire at the end of the year. Americans 60 years and older with an income of $65,000 will pay $920 more a month in 2026, according to estimates from the health research nonprofit…
title: This group will pay $920 more per month if ObamaCare subsidies expire

author: Rachel Frazin
description: President Trump is eyeing an energy deal with China, he said in a social media post Thursday. He said in a post on Truth Social that Beijing has agreed to begin purchasing U.S. energy and that a “very large scale transaction” related to oil and gas from Alaska “may take place.” “Chris Wright, Doug Burgum,…
title: Trump seeks energy deal with China amid broader trade talks

author: Rachel Frazin
description: The Senate on Thursday voted to overturn a Biden administration plan that would have restricted drilling in the Arctic. The vote was 52-45. Sen. John Fetterman (D-Pa.) joined Republicans in voting in favor. The 2022 Biden administration plan in question made about 52 percent of land available for drilling in an area known as the National…
title: Senate votes to overturn Biden move to restrict Arctic drilling

author: Sarah Fortinsky
description: Rep. Thomas Massie (R-Ky.) fired back Thursday after Vice President Vance defended President Trump for repeatedly targeting the independent-minded congressman and backing a challenger to his reelection bid. “When leaders of my own party protect sex traffickers, spend our grandkids into oblivion, fund endless wars, lockdown our citizens, bailout corporations, bow to other countries, and…
title: Massie fires back after Vance criticizes him at Turning Point USA event

author: Ryan Mancini
description: Leading Republican lawmakers have dismissed attempts to push legislative carve-outs, or “rifle shot” bills, to alleviate Americans feeling the weight of the monthlong government shutdown. Senate Majority Leader John Thune (R-S.D.) first expressed skepticism over “rifle shot” legislation when it came to paying military service members and air traffic controllers, Punchbowl News reported Tuesday. But…
title: What are ‘rifle shot’ shutdown bills, and why are GOP leaders opposed?

author: Imran Khalid, opinion contributor
description: The U.S. continues to pour weapons into Ukraine, prolonging the conflict and causing immense suffering, while neglecting diplomacy and reconstruction efforts that could bring peace.
title: Storm shadows over Bryansk: The cost of a war without an endgame

author: The Hill Staff
description: Sen. Mark Warner (D-Va.) on Thursday accused the Trump administration of excluding Democrats from a recent briefing on the U.S. strikes against alleged drug boats in the Caribbean. Warner will speak with reporters Thursday afternoon, a day after issuing a forceful statement condemning the reported partisan briefing as “indefensible” and raising concerns about a lack of…
title: Watch live: Warner airs frustration over lack of transparency on Trump boat strikes

author: Kristina Foltz, opinion contributor
description: Venezuela’s activities warrant U.S. military presence.
title: Trump is right on Venezuela: Maduro must go

author: Tara Suter
description: California Gov. Gavin Newsom (D) warned that the 2028 presidential election will be a “[Russian President Vladimir] Putin election” if his party doesn’t “stand up.” “I’ll tell you what, we won’t have a country. We won’t have an election that’s fair and free if we don’t stand up, we won’t.  There will not be a…
title: Newsom warns 2028 will be ‘Putin election’ in US if Democrats ‘don’t stand up’

author: Max Rego
description: All 43 Democratic Florida legislators sent a letter to Gov. Ron DeSantis (R) on Tuesday asking him to declare a state of emergency over the impending halt in funding for the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP). Starting Saturday, SNAP benefits for millions are set to run out as the nearly month-long government shutdown persists. “This…
title: Florida Democrats urge DeSantis to declare SNAP state of emergency

author: Jared Gans
description: Morning Report is The Hill’s a.m. newsletter. Subscribe here. In today’s issue: ▪ Trump hails ‘truly great’ Xi meeting ▪ Signs of life on ending shutdown ▪ MTG irks Republican colleagues  ▪ Far-right gets setback in Dutch elections  President Trump said he and Chinese President Xi Jinping agreed on a wide range of subjects during their much-anticipated meeting Thursday, including…
title: Trump, Xi agree to tariffs, rare earths deal

author: Max Rego
description: Radio Free Asia (RFA) announced Wednesday it is pausing operations for the first time in its history, amid the government shutdown and after the Trump administration cut its funding. In a statement, RFA executive editor Rose Hwang said the stoppage is “due to uncertain funding.” “For RFA journalists who sacrificed so much in defying powerful…
title: Radio Free Asia halting operations for first time in 29-year-history amid shutdown
